items.sentence: Tom probably wouldn\'t have done that if Mary had been there.
Tom was with his dog in the park when I saw him this morning.
Tom went into the kitchen and poured himself a cup of coffee.
I think Tom\'s grandmother is too old to be wearing a bikini.
I think it\'s unlikely that Tom will come to the party alone.
I think we shouldn\'t make a decision until we hear from Tom.
It wasn\'t easy for Tom to tell Mary what she needed to hear.
Because of the storm, we couldn\'t search for the lost child.
We aren\'t going to have an office Christmas party this year.
We hope that you\'ll be able to do everything you want to do.
Tom doesn\'t know if he can do what you\'re asking him to do.
Tom dropped a strawberry on the floor and Mary stepped on it.
You haven\'t yet done what you were supposed to do, have you?
You probably wouldn\'t even recognize Tom if you saw him now.
You should probably tell Tom why he shouldn\'t be doing that.
You won\'t believe how much money Tom gave me for my old car.
Everything at that store is 10 percent off the regular price.
She advised him not to spend all his money on his girlfriend.
We kept track of all our expenses while we were in Australia.
You should spend a little time each day reviewing vocabulary.
